trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ItemUpdating"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ItemUpdating> event when an Update button (a button with its `CommandName` property set to "Update") within the control is clicked, but before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control updates the record.
This allows you to provide an event handler that performs a custom routine, such as HTML-encoding the values of a record before updating it in the data source, whenever this event occurs.

A DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs object is passed to the event handler, which allows you to determine the value of an optional command argument sent to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control and to indicate whether the update operation should be canceled.
To determine the value of the command argument, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property.
To cancel the update operation, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.

You can also read or modify the new values entered by the user by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdatedEventArgs.Keys%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.NewValues%2A> properties.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.Keys%2A> property contains the key fields, while the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.NewValues%2A> property contains the non-key fields.
If you need to access the original non-key field values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdatedEventArgs.OldValues%2A> property.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs> class.

|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A>|The value of the `commandArgument` parameter.| > [!NOTE] > This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
An optional command argument passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets the command argument for the update operation passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property to determine the value of the command argument passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The command argument for the update operation passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets a dictionary that contains the key field name/value pairs for the record to update.
Use the Keys property to access the values of the key fields for the record to update.
For example, you can use these values to keep a log of updated records.
> [!NOTE] > This property contains only the key fields.

To access the updated and original non-key fields, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.NewValues%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.OldValues%2A> properties, respectively.
The Keys property returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> interface.
The object contains <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> objects that represent the fields of the record to update.
> [!NOTE] > As a shortcut, you can also use the indexer of the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object to access the field values directly.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains a dictionary of key field name/value pairs for the record to update.
Gets a dictionary that contains the new field name/value pairs for the record to update.
Use the NewValues property to access the new field values for the record to update.
For example, you can use these values to keep a log of updated records.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not contain the key fields.
To access the key fields, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.Keys%2A> property.
You can also access the original field values by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.OldValues%2A> property.
The NewValues property returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> interface.
The object contains <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> objects that represent the fields of the record to update.
> [!NOTE] > As a shortcut, you can also use the indexer of the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object to access the field values directly.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains a dictionary of the new field name/value pairs for the record to update.
Gets a dictionary that contains the original field name/value pairs for the record to update.
Use the OldValues property to access the original field values for the updated record.
For example, you can use these values to keep a log of updated records.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not contain the key fields.
To access the key fields, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.Keys%2A> property.
You can also access the new field values entered by the user by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewUpdateEventArgs.NewValues%2A> property.
The OldValues property returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> interface.
The object contains <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> objects that represent the fields of the record to update.
> [!NOTE] > As a shortcut, you can also use the indexer of the object to access the field values directly.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains a dictionary of the original field name/value pairs for the record to update.
